appendEncodedPath(java.lang.String).Description: Appends the given segment to the path.

opaquePart(java.lang.String).Description: Encodes and sets the given opaque scheme-specific-part.

encodedPath(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the previously encoded path. If the path is not null and doesn't start with a '/', and if you specify a scheme and/or authority, the builder will prepend the given path with a '/'.

encodedOpaquePart(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the previously encoded opaque scheme-specific-part.

Parameters: String: name or null if this is a relative Uri

clearQuery().Description: Clears the the previously set query.

Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method. The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of:

path(java.lang.String).Description: Sets the path. Leaves '/' characters intact but encodes others as necessary. If the path is not null and doesn't start with a '/', and if you specify a scheme and/or authority, the builder will prepend the given path with a '/'.

appendQueryParameter(java.lang.String,ja.Description: Encodes the key and value and then appends the parameter to the query string.
appendQueryParameter(java.lang.String,ja.FullName: public Uri.Builder appendQueryParameter (String key, String value)

Throws: if the URI is opaque and the scheme is null
build().Description: Constructs a Uri with the current attributes.

appendPath(java.lang.String).Description: Encodes the given segment and appends it to the path.

ClassDesc: Helper class for building or manipulating URI references. Not safe for concurrent use. An absolute hierarchical URI reference follows the pattern: <scheme>://<authority><absolute path>?<query>#<fragment> Relative URI references (which are always hierarchical) follow one of two patterns: <relative or absolute path>?<query>#<fragment> or //<authority><absolute path>?<query>#<fragment> An opaque URI follows this pattern: <scheme>:<opaque part>#<fragment> Use @B_android#net#Uri#buildUpon_E@ to obtain a builder representing an existing URI.
